Class IOUtilities

java.lang.Object
  se.chalmers.ait.dat215.project.util.IOUtilities

public class IOUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class for commonly used IO-related operations.

Constructor Detail

IOUtilities

public IOUtilities()
Method Detail

extractFileWithoutPath

public static java.lang.String extractFileWithoutPath(java.lang.String filePath)
Utility method for extracting the file name from a complete path like 'c:\OM.mvd\Forest.forest\B00099691_020513091546.tree' into 'B00099691_020513091546.tree'. This is necessary due to the (erroneous?) design of previous tree storage facilities, that includes a concrete pathname in the tree file.

getFileExtension

public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(java.io.File f)
Obtains the file extension of the specified file in lower case. Will return null if the file has no extension.

getFileExtension

public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(java.lang.String file)
Obtains the file extension of the specified file in lower case. Will return null if the file has no extension.

countFiles

public static int countFiles(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Returns the number of files found in the specified path. This method does not traverse any subdirectories of the path, and will return 1 if the path specifies a file. An exception is thrown if the path is nonexistant in the system.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

recursivelyCountFiles

public static int recursivelyCountFiles(java.io.File file)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Returns the number of files found in the specified path, as well as any subdirectories found (a recursive traversal is made). The integer 1 is returned if the path specifies a file, and an exception is thrown if the path is nonexistant.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

convertBufferedImageToByteArray

public static byte[] convertBufferedImageToByteArray(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                     java.lang.String format)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
Converts the specified buffered image to a byte array indicating an image with the specified format. If, for instance, you wish to make the resulting byte array represent a jpeg image, you should specify a format "jpg".

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getBytesFromInputStream

public static byte[] getBytesFromInputStream(java.io.InputStream stream)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Extracts all the bytes available from the specified InputStream into a byte array, which is returned by the method.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

copy

public static void copy(java.lang.String sourcePath,
                        java.lang.String destPath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copies the file specified by the source path to a new file specified by the destination path. Note that the destination file must not exist prior to the call of this method, or an exception will be thrown. The method will never over-write already existing files. If the path to the destination file contains branches in the directory tree that do not yet exist, these branches will be created before the destination file is written.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

                        java.lang.String destPath,
                        boolean overwriteOK)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                        java.io.File destFile)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copies the file specified by the source file to a new file specified by the destination file. Note that the destination file must not exist prior to the call of this method, or an exception will be thrown. The method will never over-write already existing files. If the path to the destination file contains branches in the directory tree that do not yet exist, these branches will be created before the destination file is written.

                 throws java.io.IOException

copy

public static void copy(java.io.InputStream input,
                        java.io.File destFile)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copies the data from the specified input stream into the specified destination file. Note that the destination file must not exist prior to the call of this method, or an exception will be thrown. The method will never over-write already existing files. If the path to the destination file contains branches in the directory tree that do not yet exist, these branches will be created before the destination file is written.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

copy

public static void copy(java.io.InputStream input,
                        java.io.File destFile,
                        boolean overwriteOK)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

copy

public static void copy(java.io.InputStream input,
                        java.io.OutputStream output)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copies, in an effective manner, byte data from the input stream into raw byte data to the output stream. Will close both the input and the output stream after the operation. If this is not desired, use the expanded version of the method.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

copy

public static void copy(java.io.InputStream input,
                        java.io.OutputStream output,
                        boolean closeIn,
                        boolean closeOut)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copies, in an effective manner, byte data from the input stream into raw byte data to the output stream. The close parameters indicates whether or not the input and output streams should be closed after the operation.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

serialClone

public static java.lang.Object serialClone(java.io.Serializable obj)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
A utility method for cloning objects. Note that the object you wish to clone must be serializable. A copy of the specified object will be returned, all you have to do is make sure that the object is tagged as Serializable (which will automatically make sure that all fields and object references are serialized and properly cloned).

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

getRecognizedFileSeparators

public static java.lang.String[] getRecognizedFileSeparators()
Returns a string array of all recognized file separators.
